context: In high school, I played water polo and swam competitvely. I am a recordholder for my high school in the 100 yard breast stroke, and 4x100 yard freestyle relay. In college, I tried to continue my aquatic journey; however, with the COVID-19 pandemic it was hard to find facilities near me.

As I’ve gotten older, I have become so appreciative of free time, and pleasure reading. I have found that I enjoy queer novels, and seeing myself in these stories. It is an extra plus if its a queer mythology novel such as the The Song of Achilles by Madeline Miller. I love seeing queer poc representation like that in Red, White & Royal Blue by Casey McQuiston. If you have an book recommendations feel free to send them my way :)

From various classes at Dartmouht, I have found a strong interest in political ecology. The concept is a perfect intersection between environmental science and social justice, tackling concepts such as environmental justice. My interest was sparked from Exide toxic dumping in South East Los Angeles. I feel strongly about companies taking advantage of the environment and communities of color for their own capital gains.

I am a Scoprio Sun, Libra Moon, and Scorpio rising being born in mid November. I love learning other people’s signs and find it entertaining to see the conceptions others have of each of the 12 astrological signs. The community that forms from astrology is strong and powerful.
